title: SQLGROUP BY Keyword

metadata.description: Learn about SQLGROUP BY Keyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Reference

❯
GROUP BY
The
GROUP BY
command is used to group the result set (used with aggregate functions: COUNT, MAX, MIN, SUM, 
AVG).
The following SQL lists the number of customers in each country:
Example
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), Country
FROM Customers
GROUP BY Country;

The following SQL lists the number of customers in each country, 
sorted high to low:
Example
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), Country
FROM Customers
GROUP BY Country
ORDER BY COUNT(CustomerID) DESC;

Reference

❯
★
+1

content_sections.title: Example
Example
content_sections.code:
SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), Country
FROM Customers
GROUP BY Country
ORDER BY COUNT(CustomerID) DESC;

SELECT COUNT(CustomerID), Country
FROM Customers

practice_exercises.solution:

FROM Customers

summary: This tutorial covers SQLGROUP BY Keyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQLGROUP BY Keyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQLGROUP BY Keyword and how to apply it in your projects.
